title: Acrostic 136
friendlyquote: The surface of American society is covered with a layer of democratic paint, but from time to time one can see the old aristocratic colors breaking through.
quote: THE SURFACE OF AMERICAN SOCIETY IS COVERED WITH A LAYER OF DEMOCRATIC PAINT BUT FROM TIME TO TIME ONE CAN SEE THE OLD ARISTOCRATIC COLORS BREAKING THROUGH

clues.clue: Artist known for mathematically-inspired, physics-defying woodcuts and lithographs (3 wds.)
Reviewer, as for a movie or restaurant; "Everyone's a _____"
Connecticut's state song, whose titular character "stuck a feather in his cap" (2 wds.)
Pennsylvania town named after FDR's First Lady by taking the final syllables of her first and last name
Negatively-charged subatomic particle...or, when a space is added, a possible campaign slogan for Reagan?
Unusual knickknack; when US is added, it becomes an adjective that can describe such a knickknack
